title: @Riot is there a mage rework coming?
body: The new ad itemization blows ap itemization out of the water and there are so many ap champs that need help. A responce would be nice

replies.body:
We haven't decided yet which class of characters/set of items we might tackle once Marksmen are done. Some form of caster's definitely got some appeal, since we've done a couple of auto attacking/AD using classes in juggernauts and marksmen. There's also some good arguments for a subset of tanks or supports too though, since the two classes we've worked on have both been primary damage dealers, so hitting a more utility focused class would offer some good contrast. Finally there's also some appeal in tackling a class that's been hard to balance and itemize for historically, so assassins for example would also have a fair bit of merit as a choice.

As far as quality of choices go I'm with you that the new AD itemization's a big step up. Personally it feels more like AD itemization (for some characters at least) is catching up to where AP itemization's  generally been though, rather than eclipsing it.

AD casters getting an actually good spellvamp option before actual mages are.

That is kinda stupid.

(And honestly, when people complain about AP itemization, they're basically just complaining about Zhonya's.)
You know they're buffing WotA, right?  It's a full 200g cheaper on the PBE with no loss of stats.

> [{quoted}](name=Zantumall,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GE26aGB8,comment-id=000000040000,timestamp=2015-11-03T06:42:09.441+0000)
>
> You know they're buffing WotA, right?  It's a full 200g cheaper on the PBE with no loss of stats.

While giving AD an 800 gold Grievous Wounds item. I largely feel that buff is there because the "Spell Vamp" has been effectively cut down to 10% from 15%.

I really doubt we're going to see GW in every game (although I do think that Executioner's should activate below a certain health threshold, like Morello's does now, but that's beside the point).  I suspect that with WotA 200g cheaper it'll be a more appealing option for mages who can make good use of it but don't have enough built-in sustain to warrant buying GW against them, especially manaless champs like Kennen and Katarina who used to buy revolver in lane.  I could be wrong, but I don't really see anyone buying Executioner's just to counter a WotA, I feel like it'll mostly only get bought when the enemy team has a Swain/Vlad/Mundo/etc.

The Grievous Wounds passive isn't on Executioner's Calling, it's on Last Whisper.  Yeah, that armor pen item bought by just about every ADC already?  It cuts down on healing now.  People who play healing dependent champions aren't exactly happy about this.
It's on Executioner's Calling, not on Last Whisper, but those two items combine to make a new item with both of their passives.

Oh cool, thanks for the correction, haven't been all that up to date with the specific preseason changes.  Still, with Riot encouraging the item with the absurd amount of lifesteal and healing ADCs are getting (not to mention the damage reduction), it still means that healing based champions are going to get screwed by this, especially since it doesn't really have the same limits that Morellonomicon does.

It actually has more limits. Morellos is overall a good item with a passive that nobody cares about. Morellos needs to be good without the passive or else nobody would get it.

The new LW upgrades are differnt. there are 2 (riot even said a 3rd is probably coming later this season) options. One that reduces healing and the other one increases AA dmg by up to 15% if a target has more max HP than you, which is the case for most champs comapred to ADCs. AD assassins, brusiers, juggernauts, casters, ... even backline supports with Sightstone have more HP than ADCs. With only +500 HP a caster takes 15% more AA dmg from ADCs. So a caster that builds ROA or Rylais actually wasted all the gold for the HP stat because he will die in nearly the same time against an ADC.

Having to decide between healing reduction and that +0-15% AA dmg passive, most people will go fo the AA enhancement except they have a very problematic Mundo or Aatrox on the enemies team and no Morellos and Ignite. Sacrificing so much for a healing reduction that doesn't even counter Soraka anymore (only counters self sustain, not healing from other champs) is a huge thing for DDs and no easy choice.

It is very likely that Riot has to reduce some healing effects in the late game due to the nerfed healing reduction (Soraka, Heal and maybe even soem self sustain like Mundos rank 3 ult).
Incorrect. It is indeed on Executioner's Calling and its higher tier item. Last Whisper and up has bonus armor pen.
I'm aware of this now, see my reply to the above post.
Executioner's Calling and Last Whisper combine to make Mortal Reminder or something like that, i forget what its called but basically yes... we will be seeing it every game.

Getting the GW LW will help against the healing, but ADCs are sacrificing the 15% bonus dmg vs most frontline targets, which is huge. Do you really think they are throwing that away to counter 40% of a single WotA? WotA has good sustain if it comes to sieging or really close fights.

And don't forget that a lot of AP mids already had a morellos anyways. 

And Death's Dance only has 12% raw dmg as LS while WotA still has 15%. that is a huge difference. It also costs 900 more gold and has no smaller version that can give you sustain. if you want to go for a certain stat/passive/active and you need to wait for 3.4k gold to actually get it, it makes the stat/passive/active very unattractive for the early game. 

Look at the current ER. Actually a good item, but when you get it, you actually want to use the sustain in the laning phase (same with WotA), but you need to get to the finished item before you are able to cover that weakness of yours with its bonuses. WotA doesn't have that problem. 

Death's Dance has a similar problem. The only good thing about it is that it also offers the 3 sec dmg delay for 12% of the incoming dmg. that was good when it was 20% or if it would still be 5 sec, but that passive is not that strong anymore and the item loses to most other dmg items for giving less sustain than WotA for way more gold when it comes to AD casters. It gives more sustain to AA champs due to the constant DPS instead of bursting.
And it also doesn't have that neat passive.

Yeah, but it doesn't need it.  The passive on Death's Dance is an anti-burst mechanism, and Zhonya's already fills that role for mages (as do the numerous good Health/AP items, to a lesser extent).  Death's Dance just has to be a passive instead of an active because AD carries need to keep auto attacking to be worth anything; most mages can blow their burst combo, pop Zhonya's, and have cooldowns ready when it ends without losing any DPS time.

10% Lifesteal is on par with 400 HP after you deal 4000 physical damage post-reduction.

A Bloodthirster or Ravenous Hydra provides enough sustain to be about as much bonus HP as a Rod of Ages at full stacks (Hydra is assuming you have multiple targets in the fight, otherwise it's weak). BotRK, current live Essence Reaver and PBE Death's Dance provide about as much sustain as a Rylai's Crystal Scepter provides HP.

It works a lot better for a mage to have RoA and Rylai's in their first two slots than it does for most champions to stack Lifesteal items before 5th slot.

Never mind that Mages have Armor and MR, whereas ADCs only have MR, and the AD/health items don't benefit ADCs so much as the bruisers *who freaking needed them.*

Not for buffs **or** nerfs, itemization maybe? Or just some general gameplay changes for them. Those both seem to be a pretty awkward state. Feast/famine or over/under tuned. None of those seem to have a happy medium with the way the game works around them.

EG: panth seem to be in an 'ok' spot right now, but getting a buff by way of blocking AA based cc's....he might go to OP levels, then a minor nerf to his stats to fix that might make him unviable. No middle grounds.

I know people want tanks to work, but I feel like tanks can be fixed by number tweeks/slight item buffs/nerfs. I don't think they need as big of an overhaul as people think.

Akali, Kat, Eve, and Kha are more or less known to be unbalanceable by way of numbers. Because they've been changed a lot, and still have not felt right in a long time. They need something bigger to make them work out.

Actually i do think tanks need an overhaul and not just numbers tweaking or item buffing. They are simply to binary now they become hard to kill and have cc thats it. Yes they are slightly different but thats pretty much what they do engage and soak damage. In which case the most reliable one's will always come out on top. lIke Malphite or Maokai their cc is hard to dodge and they have good defense steroid.

Btw Mundo and Olaf are not ad casters they are aggro tanks with good innate sustain damage and tenacity. they sit on your caries are difficult to dps down and bring good damage whilst being hard to peel off. They are actually a kind of tank with a very clear unique kind of ability. Think of them as fighter/bruiser tanks.

But all the other tanks do very similar things. They could differentiate in tanking capabilities. Sion needs his passive to stack hp in order to become tanky in the first place, what if for example the health he stacks is added as a red bar, or red health, this hp would be immune to all kinds of %hp damage including %hp true damage(but not flat true damage). Then give his shield a bit of an overhaul too where it lets true damage pass through hitting sion directly but as long as the shield perists he receives 30% less magic damage. This would make him strong vs hyper carries like Vayne and Kog but not any different vs jinx for example, in fact he has low base armor making him the weakest of all tanks vs normal carries. He can potentially become a hypertank but only by stacking this health, which compensates for his weak early game, he only gets more defense vs dps ap and therefore also alot of %hp ap damage if he does not use his shield for damage. meanwhile the rest of his kit is still high risk high reward in terms of cc peel and damage, everything needs to charge up for cc and damage and they are also skillshots making them easy to avoid, but devastating if they land. 

Malphite for example already has a powerfull armor steroid and scales with armor. This could be emphasised more by giving him maybe an option to increase his base armor aswell. This would make him very strong vs normal ad dps but less so vs true dmg and magic damage.

Just an example of ideas here. But giving tanks stronger different tanking niches makes one tank more valueble then others in different situations. On top of that they can also differentiate in damage more in terms of overal damage potential, burst, dps, reliable damage, skillshot dependant, magic damage heavy, physical damage heavy. And differences in teamfighting by having better engage or better peel. More utility can also be added to tanks giving them better different niche roles for tank diversity.

While i do agree assasins are in a somewhat bad spot at the moment they can literally only be good for 1 situation and that is picking off soft targets before a fight starts. they often need high base damage and good scaling with mobility, and this often creates problems when they snowball they start bursting tanks and squishies alike which is a bit unhealthy. using mobilty to get some low risk high reward plays which makes it more unhealthy when they start snowballing, i mean look at Riven for example she never has to fight if she doesnt want to which is somehwat unhealthy for snowball reliant champions. First riot needs to find a way to make these champions less snowball reliant, and i dont really have an idea how, right now its stomp or be stomped with alot of peeling otions in items making hings difficult as the game progresses, give them too much free stats and power and they start facerolling over everything else again.

I feel the flaw is AD caster items being the same (for the most part) to AD assassin items. With the items being tuned for AD assassins. So the AD casters will either be strong or weak, depending on how well the AD assassin items work with them. Having their own item class would help a lot. As you could tune the items that are good for AD casters other than the AD casters themselves...which, historically, just doesn't work out.

Now the option is closer to-
Buff AD assassin items...and Talon becomes Warlord Destroyer of Worlds again, Riven becomes even more of a pain in the ass...and assassins themselves turn out 'ok.' Or buff/nerf each AD caster, each ending up slightly OP or UP, depending on numbers, and trying to slightly change numbers either makes them OP or unviable. (As we've seen happen with Kha and Talon repeatedly.)

I think the problems are the outliers like garen/darius as juggernaught with lots of innate damage and tankyness they generaly just build black cleaver for the shred and thats all they need to man handle any tank. the other outliers are champions like fiora with her massive true damage and ability to block everything. Or riven acting as a tribrid of bruiser assasin ad caster with toxic amounts of mobility cc and shielding.

These champions tend to get away with abusing current strong items whilst not being reliant on some of the other weaker items aswell. 

Tanks seem to fail against all of these in one situation or another, either their armor get shredded their outsustained their armor or cc gets straight ignored, skillshot cc countered by hyper mobility, or they lack general early game damage or sustain to at least go even to some extend.

Different itemization is pretty difficult since both scale off the same stat, i can see numbers tweaking like scaling and base damages working better for a quickfix.

As for tanks general strengts to tank better worse vs different damage types and enemy types like tanks whom fare well vs juggernaught & ad casters other are better vs hyper carries, etc etc at least then you have options to deal with what the enemy team is picking. Or a siege tank with long ranged poke options. 

For the ad users this might also be where differences between ad casters and ad assasins can come in like splitpush vs siege or defensive ad casters or assasins with some form of extra utility. But make them fullfill beter niche options.

Quick thought on what an AD caster item might be:
A: higher cdr than normal on an AD item (but less AD/other stats)
B: something reverse of 'on-hit' like {{item:3091}}, where a skill does something extra *on spell cast/landing a skillshot*, similar to how {{item:3025}} works on {{champion:81}}'s Q, but able to work off of other champions who don't have a skill like Ezreal's Q. (Not saying it has to be an AoE slow like IBG, just something added to a skill hit, not an AA hit. Could be an over time damage, like {{item:3151}}, but made for an AD?)
C: something like {{item:3508}}, but not all fk'd like reaver is...

Point would be to give stats/passives/actives that would be really nice for an AD caster to have, but not slot efficient for people who deal most of their damage through straight AA's. Like a burn damage item for landing a skill on {{champion:23}} would be fairly useless (as he only has 1 skill that could proc it, and he mostly only uses that to get in/out of a fight, half the time not even hitting an enemy champ with it), but it would be insanely good on {{champion:126}}, as he could proc it 3 or 4 times in a row.
